patch:
diff --git a/packages/plugins/i18n/server/src/services/ai-localizations.ts b/packages/plugins/i18n/server/src/services/ai-localizations.ts
index 3d21a605656b..8694a1811039 100644
--- a/packages/plugins/i18n/server/src/services/ai-localizations.ts
+++ b/packages/plugins/i18n/server/src/services/ai-localizations.ts
@@ -11,7 +11,12 @@ const createAILocalizationsService = ({ strapi }: { strapi: Core.Strapi }) => {
   const aiServerUrl = process.env.STRAPI_AI_URL || 'https://strapi-ai.apps.strapi.io';
   const aiLocalizationJobsService = getService('ai-localization-jobs');
 
-  const UNSUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTE_TYPES: Schema.Attribute.Kind[] = ['media', 'relation', 'boolean'];
+  const UNSUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTE_TYPES: Schema.Attribute.Kind[] = [
+    'media',
+    'relation',
+    'boolean',
+    'enumeration',
+  ];
   const IGNORED_FIELDS = [
     'id',
     'documentId',
problem_statement: AI i18n throws an error when a Enum field is present ### Node Version 20.19.5 ### NPM/Yarn/PNPM Version 4.10.3 ### Strapi Version 5.31.3 ### Operating System MacOS ### Database SQLite ### Javascript or Typescript Typescript ### Reproduction URL _No response_ ### Bug Description An error is thrown when there is a translatable enum and AI i18n is enabled. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Add a Growth licence 3. Enable i18n AI + add locales 4. Create a schema with an enum field that is localised 6. Create an entry, select an enum value and save ### Expected Behavior The enum should be translated and saved. ### Logs ```shell [2025-12-03 10:16:48.197] info: AI token generated successfully Strapi Transfer CLI --force issue
### Node Version

20.15.0

### NPM/Yarn/PNPM Version

yarn 4.4.1

### Strapi Version

5.14.0

### Operating System

Linux (Debian/Ubuntu)

### Database

PostgreSQL

### Javascript or Typescript

Typescript

### Reproduction URL

_No response_

### Bug Description

Hey guys. It seems that in version v5.14.0 the `--force` parameter of strapi transfer CLI is broken. Below is my CLI call with said parameter and correct `--from` and `--from-token` parameters. And it still prompts for the URL (and then token) even though they're passed through the call and the `--force` parameter is present.


```
runner@fv-az720-478:~/work/redacted$ yarn strapi transfer \
--from https://valid-origin-url.com/admin \
--from-token 123-valid-token-123 \
--force \
--exclude files 
ℹ️  No transfer configuration found in environment variables
   → Add STRAPI_TRANSFER_URL and STRAPI_TRANSFER_TOKEN environment variables to make the transfer process faster for future runs
? Enter the URL of the remote Strapi instance to send data to: 
```

It works the same way locally (MacOS m3 14.6) and on Github runner instance (Ubuntu 22.04).
I think it might be related to the new transfer CLI feature from [this pr](https://github.com/strapi/strapi/pull/23421)
Am I doing something wrong or is it a bug? It worked properly in v5.13. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run transfer command with `--from`, `--from-token` and `--force` parameters.
2. Observe CLI prompts still appearing.

### Expected Behavior

Transfer going through. CLI not prompting for additional information.

### Logs

```shell

```
